Dear Melynda Williams:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the
severity of the youth's behavior, chronological and
1

developmental age, size, gender, physical condition, medical
condition, psychiatric condition, and personal history,
including any history of trauma, and must be done in a
manner consistent with the youth's treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 allegedly completed an inappropriate restraint on Youth A.
Investigation Interviews:
I interviewed Complainant 1 on 2/27/25 via telephone.
Complainant 1 did not provide any new information.
The following interviews were conducted with DHHS Worker
at the facility on 2/28/25.
Youth A reported he was playing hide and seek on 2/24/25 with
Youth B. Youth A reported he was hiding in the cubbies and Staff
1 asked him to come out of it. Youth A reported he yelled at Staff
1 and told Staff 1 to “stop talking to me.” Staff 1 continued to
redirect him. Youth A reported he came over to Staff 1 and hit him
in the head. Youth A reported Staff 1 restrained him in a child
position restraint. Youth A reported while they were on the ground,
Staff 1 hit Youth A’s head against the wall. Youth A reported Staff
1 was sitting behind him in the child restraint and Staff 1 was the
one up against the wall. Staff 2 came into the room and told Staff
1 to let him go, which Staff 1 did. Youth A reported he had a cut
on his bottom lip from Staff 1. Youth A reported he did not know
how Staff 1 cut his lip. Youth A reported he was aggressive with
Staff 1.
Staff 3 reported she was working on 2/24/25 and was called to
come assist with Youth A. Staff 3 reported when she came into
the room, Staff 1 was in a small child restraint with Youth A. Youth
A was saying, “Staff 1 punched me.” Staff 1 was sitting on the
floor and Youth A was sitting on the floor in front of him. Staff 1
had Youth A’s arms wrapped around him, but they were not
secured. Staff 3 reported she told Staff 1 to release him due to not
being able to get his arms secured. Staff 1 released Youth A. Both
Staff 1 and Youth A got up from the floor and Youth A went
aggressively after Staff 1. Staff 1 completed another small child
restraint, but they were not able to control Youth A’s legs, so he
released Youth A and Youth A went after Staff 1 again. At this
time, she told Staff 1 to leave the unit, and he did. Staff 3 reported
Staff 1 was not aggressive with Youth A. Staff 3 reported Youth A
had a cut lip when she first entered the unit but was unable to say
2

how Youth A received this. Staff 3 reported she has never seen
Staff 1 aggressive with any youth.
Staff 4 reported he heard someone yelling “help” in the unit, so he
entered to help. Staff 4 reported Staff 1 and Staff 3 were in the
room and Staff 1 was attempting to put Youth A into a restraint.
Youth A was stating, “He punched me. I am going to get him”.
Staff 4 reported he did not see Youth A harmed in any manner.
Staff 1 was able to get Youth A into a small child restraint but was
told to let Youth A up by Staff 3. Staff 3 was attempting to switch
with Staff 1, due to Staff 1 being a target of Youth A. Once Staff 1
let him up, Staff 1 was told to leave the unit. Staff 4 reported as he
was leaving Youth A was able to get loose from Staff 3 and went
after Staff 1 aggressively. Staff 4 reported he has never seen Staff
1 aggressive and reported he is usually a very mellow staff.
Youth B reported he was playing hide and go seek with Youth A
on 2/24/25 when Youth A got into a “fight” with Staff 1. Youth B
reported he did not see Youth A get hit in the mouth, only heard
Youth A say he was punched. Youth B reported Staff 3 came in
and told Staff 1 to leave and Staff 1 left. Youth B reported he didn’t
see anything else.
The following interviews were completed on 3/7/25 with
MDHHS Worker at the facility.
Staff 2 reported Staff 1 was sitting in a chair. He redirected Youth
A to come out of the cubbies. Youth A then aggressively came
over to Staff 1 and started hitting Staff 1. Staff 1 placed him in a
small child restraint, and she came over and held Youth A’s legs
down. Staff 1 asked Youth A if he was calm and when Youth A
said, “yes,” Staff 1 let him out of the restraint. Once out of the
restraint Youth A then continued to be aggressive with Staff 1.
Staff 2 reported she asked for help and Staff 3 and Staff 4 came
into the unit. Staff 2 reported she took Youth B out of the unit and
did not see the rest of the situation. Staff 2 reported she has never
known Staff 1 to become aggressive.
Staff 1 reported Youth A was hiding in the cubbies, and he
directed him to come out of them. Staff 1 reported Youth A
became aggressive and attacked him. Staff 1 reported he put
Youth A into a small child restraint. Staff 1 reported they were
sitting down; Youth A was able to get his arms loose, so he let
Youth A up. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 was in the room at this time.
Youth A attempted to hit him again, so he put him in another small
child restraint but again couldn’t get his arms in the right position.
3

Staff 2 told him to let Youth A up from the restraint, so he did. Staff
3 and Staff 4 came into the room. Staff 1 left the room.
Video Reviewed:
I watched the video for the alleged incident. The date of the video
was 2/24/25. The video started at 1:05:11pm and ended at
1:07:05pm. Staff 1 completed two small child restraints. Youth A
was aggressive and attacked Staff 1 while he was sitting in a
chair. Staff 1 then grabbed Youth A’s arms and wrapped them
around his waist and sat down on the floor with him. Staff 1 sat
behind him and held his arms in place. Staff 2 came over to the
restraint and Youth A was released from the restraint. Staff 1
stood up and Youth A attempted to attack Staff 1. Staff 1 grabbed
Youth A’s arms and wrapped them around his waist and sat down
with Youth A sitting in front of him. Staff 1 was struggling to keep
Youth A’s arms in place, due to Youth A attempting to get out of
restraint. Staff 3 and Staff 4 came into the room and Staff 1 got
up from the restraint.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file was up to date with training and
clearances. Staff 1 had TCI training on 11/26/24.
• I reviewed the Behavior Management policy which reports
TCI as its restraint model.
• I reviewed the TCI manual and both restraints were
consistent with the small child restraint.
• Staff 1 had disciplinary action on 6/6/24 for using physical
interventions not consistent with TCI training.
• I reviewed the Incident Report dated 2/24/25. Staff 4
completed the incident report and reported Staff 1 pushed
Youth A as he left the unit.
• I reviewed the Post Debriefing forms dated 2/24/25; Youth
A refused post debriefing.
• I reviewed the Nursing notes dated 2/24/25. Notes report
Youth A had dried blood in his nose and no bruising. He
denied allowing staff to look at abdomen, back, and legs.
Analysis The agency is compliant with this rule. Based on interviews with
Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 4, along with video observation,
the small child restraint was done in agreement with TCI training.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
4

(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff 1 pushed Youth A as he was leaving the unit.
Investigation Interviews:
Staff 1 was interviewed on 3/7/25 at the facility. Staff 1 reported
Staff 2 and Staff 4 were next to him when he was leaving the room
and Youth A came after him. Staff 1 reported he pushed Youth A,
but he did so because Staff 2 and Staff 4 did not see Youth A
coming after him. Staff 1 reported he shouldn’t have pushed Youth
A but just extended both arms to stop Youth A. Staff 1 reported he
did not hit Youth A’s head on the wall or punch him. Staff 1
reported after the second restraint he noticed Youth A’s mouth
was bleeding, but he did not know how that happened.
Staff 4 was interviewed on 2/28/25 at the facility. Staff 4 reported
Staff 1 pushed Youth A and the push caused Youth A to go
backwards. Staff 4 reported Staff 1 never said anything derogatory
to Youth A. Staff 4 reported the push Staff 1 did was not a part of
their restraint model.
Video Reviewed:
I watched the video for the alleged incident. As Staff 1 was leaving
the unit at 1:07:05pm, Youth A aggressive went after Staff 1 and
Staff 1 pushed Youth A.
Documents Reviewed
• I reviewed the behavior management policy The policy
reports that pushing is not approved behavior management
technique.
Analysis The agency is non-compliant with this rule. Video observation and
interviews with Staff 1 and Staff 4 confirm Staff 1 pushed Youth A
as he was leaving the unit.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
